main event: An observer reported sighting six bright lights in a V-shape formation over Rome, New York on March 27, 1966.
interesting points: The lights were brighter than Jupiter at that time,The observer noted the lights were first seen overhead and disappeared over the northern horizon,The observer mentioned being deaf and could not hear any sounds from the lights,There was no physical evidence or photographs associated with this sighting,The report concluded that the lights could possibly be conventional aircraft.
sighted object: six lights in a V-shape formation
